author: Madison Myers
title: Attendance drops at McGregor ISD after flu spike
text:
MCGREGOR, Texas ‚Äî McGregor ISD has seen a drop in attendance due to a recent spike in flu cases, affecting both students and staff. Local doctors are urging precautions, including getting flu vaccinations.
McGregor ISD reports a significant drop in attendance, with 87% attendance over the past two weeks, compared to the usual 95%. Local doctors have seen a rise in flu cases, particularly Flu A, urging vaccinations and hygiene to reduce the spread. Flu cases in Waco-McLennan County show 196 Flu A cases and 16 Flu B cases as of Wednesday. BROADCAST TRANSCRIPT:
" One of the things that's really difficult about the flu is just how contagious it is,‚Äù said Dr. Samuel Clark with Baylor Scott and White.
That's something our neighbors in McGregor are experiencing first hand.
In a statement, McGregor ISD Superintendent Travis Mutscher confirms attendance in the district has dropped in the past two weeks due to students and teachers out with the flu.
On the worst day, attendance plummeted to 87%.
It's normally at 95% or higher.
"In the past 3 months we've seen a significant uptick in the number of flu cases, that vast majority of that has been flu A,‚Äù said Clark.
Local doctors say they're also seeing the spike.
According to the Waco-McLennan County flu dashboard, as of Wednesday afternoon, there are currently 196 cases of flu A and 16 cases of Flu B.
"This year there seems to be a pretty strong strain of Flu A,‚Äù said Clark.
McGregor ISD says the flu is also significantly impacting teachers, causing them to have to shuffle around to get enough coverage for their classrooms.
Doctors have this advice for you to help prevent the spread.
" Certainly the number one thing to do is just get your flu vaccine. There are a lot of people asking if it's too late to get the flu vaccine, 'should I still get it', the answer is absolutely yes. If you have an older kid try to keep them out of contact with some of the rest of the family or school age friends,‚Äù said Clark.
McGregor ISD says it's prioritizing cleaning procedures in their classrooms and cafeteria, and reminding students to wash their hands.
But the number one piece of advice from local doctors;
" If you have kids that are sick, keep them home,‚Äù said Clark.
Follow Madison on social media!

author: @httweets
title: Greater Noida draws up plan to save Surajpur wetland from polluted discharge - Hindustan Times
text: Taking cognizance of the constant water pollution at the Surajpur Wetland, the Greater Noida authority directed officials to undertake measures to clean up the site and prevent further pollution, said officials. Srilakshmi VS, additional CEO, Greater Noida, on Thursday issued a series of directives aimed at addressing the growing environmental concerns at the wetland. The instructions came following a review meeting on September 20, held in response to significant damage to the wetland‚Äôs trees and plants, possibly from unchecked disposal of chemical and dirty waste from nearby industrial units and residential areas, said an officials from Greater Noida authority. The meeting was attended by officials from the Greater Noida authority, Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board (UPPCB), and the forest department, along with environmentalist Vikrant Tongad.Officials said on-site inspection was held recently and the entire team reviewed the sources of pollution affecting the wetland ecological balance, particularly its trees and plants. The inspection revealed that untreated water from Sector Ecotech 3, Police Lines, and nearby industries, was being discharged into the wetland, causing significant harm to the flora.‚ÄúThe Surajpur wetland is a critical ecological zone, and we cannot allow it to suffer from unchecked pollution. Immediate action is essential to protect its biodiversity, and all departments concerned must work swiftly to ensure that necessary steps are taken to prevent further damage,‚Äù said Srilakshmi VS.The ACEO directed immediate construction of a 700m long RCC drain to divert the wastewater from Ecotech 3 Sector and Police Lines into an existing drain along DSC Road.Work circle 3 officials of Greater Noida said an estimate has been prepared for constructing the RCC drain and officials concerned have now been instructed to obtain administrative, financial, and technical approvals for the project. As for the discharge of chemical waste from an industrial unit located adjacent to the wetland, Srilakshmi VS has directed the establishment concerned to immediately make alternative arrangements for the disposal of wastewater into the DSC Road drain.‚ÄúThese solutions are expected to be sustainable and provide lasting protection to the wetland,‚Äù said Srilakshmi VS.‚ÄúNecessary instructions have been issued to the officials to take steps on all fronts, including construction of RCC drain for Sector Ecotech 3 and Police Lines. Industrial units have been asked to ensure proper wastewater disposal, and a long-term solution for Surajpur village‚Äôs drainage, which is essential to protect the wetland ecosystem, is also under consideration,‚Äù said Srilakshmi VS.

author: Get News
title: Empowering Future Healers: Dr. Jeremy Barnett Scholarship Announces Recipient of Scholarship Award | User | dailytimesleader.com
text:
Dr. Jeremy Barnett Olean, NY - In an exciting culmination of the Dr. Jeremy Barnett Scholarship, medical students across the United States showcased their passion and creativity in response to the essay question: How would you use your medical degree to help benefit society? Today, we are thrilled to announce the deserving winner of the $1,000 scholarship, aimed at supporting the academic journey of talented students facing financial challenges in pursuing their medical education.
Jeremy Barnett , a seasoned medical professional with over 20 years of experience, initiated this scholarship program to alleviate the burden of costly medical college expenses faced by many gifted and bright students. The essay contest, which served as the basis for selecting the scholarship recipient, invited applicants to articulate their visions for making a meaningful impact on society through their medical careers.
After careful consideration, the scholarship committee is pleased to award the Dr. Jeremy Barnett Scholarship to our winner, whose compelling essay demonstrated a profound commitment to using their medical degree to bring positive change to people's lives.
The $1,000 scholarship funds will be dedicated to covering tuition fees for [Winner's Name]'s entire degree program at an accredited medical school in the United States.
Dr. Jeremy Barnett emphasizes the importance of supporting aspiring doctors in their educational journey, stating, "I understand the struggles that students face during their years of schooling on the road to becoming physicians. The scholarship aims to provide not only financial assistance but also encouragement for these talented individuals to pursue their dreams."
Medical scholarships play a crucial role in empowering ambitious students to overcome the rising costs of tuition and living expenses associated with medical school. The Dr. Jeremy Barnett Scholarship stands as a testament to Dr. Barnett's commitment to fostering the next generation of healthcare professionals.
For aspiring medical students seeking financial aid, the Dr. Jeremy Barnett Scholarship continues to be a beacon of hope. The scholarship committee congratulates the winner of our scholarship and encourages all medical students to consider applying for future opportunities.
To learn more about the Dr. Jeremy Barnett Scholarship and stay updated on upcoming application cycles, please visit the official website at https://drjeremybarnettscholarship.com
About Dr. Jeremy Barnett :
Dr. Jeremy Barnett is a board-certified medical doctor with a wealth of experience spanning over two decades. He graduated from the University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey, completed his internship at Baystate Medical Centre, and attended residency sessions at the University of Medicine and Dentistry University and Long Island Jewish Hospital. Dr. Barnett is dedicated to not only providing excellent patient care but also supporting the educational aspirations of future healthcare professionals through initiatives like the Dr. Jeremy Barnett Scholarship. For more information, visit https://drjeremybarnettscholarship.com

author: Vikash Sharma
title: BJP activists resort to 'purification rituals' after BJD leader VK Pandian√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s Bhadrak visit
text:
Recommended Stories
House surgeons stage dharna at Bhima Bhoi Medical College after assault on medico; health services hit
There seems to be no let up in the ongoing attacks by the Opposition BJP on BJD leader and Ama Odisha, Nabin Odisha Chairman VK Pandian following the controversy surrounding social media influencer Kamiya Jani‚Äôs entry to Puri Lord Jagannath temple.
A day after Pandian visited ‚ÄòShaheed Padia‚Äô in Asurali in Bhadrak, BJP activists today 'purified' the place with water mixed with cow dung and turmeric. The leaders alleged that 'the martyrs‚Äô soil got defiled by the visit of Pandian to the place who is promoting beef consumption on Odisha Chief Minister‚Äôs directions'.
Scores of men and women from Sri Bairagi Sishu Mandir took out a rally and reached the Saheed Padia and sprinkled cow dung and turmeric water on the entire area.
Also Read:
VHP demands investigation as row erupts over Kamiya Jani
‚ÄúThe way VK Pandian took Kamiya Jani, who consumes and promotes beef, into Puri Srimandir and offered Maha Prasad is not acceptable. It is an attempt to defame Hindu culture. Mahila Morcha and others sprinkled the entire area here with cow dung to purify it. We urge everybody to come forward to save Jagannath culture,‚Äù said Bhadrak BJP Mahila Morcha leader, Kalpana Jena.
Responding to the allegations made by the BJP, BJD leader Harekrushna Padhy said, ‚ÄúThis shows the Opposition has become intolerant and is frustrated. The stadium where the meeting was held has been named after martyrs. Those who sprinkled cow dung water need to purify themselves first. The Opposition has nothing to do other than coming up with frivolous allegations and opposing the government.‚Äù
Also Read:
Indira Gandhi could not enter Puri Srimandir, but Kamiya Jani could! How & Why, asks BJP
- Reported by:
- Partha Sarathi nayak

author: jmuiba
title: Avanza la socializaci√≥n de la Ciudadela de la Salud y ven inter√©s para financiarla
text:
Avanza la socializaci√≥n de la Ciudadela de la Salud y ven inter√©s para financiarla
La Gobernaci√≥n de Cochabamba contin√∫a con la socializaci√≥n del proyecto de la Ciudadela de la Salud, inform√≥ ayer el secretario de Planificaci√≥n de la Gobernaci√≥n, Guillermo Bazoberry. Coment√≥ que ‚Äúvarios proponentes‚Äù expresaron su inter√©s para financiar esta megaobra.
‚ÄúHay varios proponentes interesados, pero corresponde realizar las gestiones ante el Viceministerio de Inversi√≥n P√∫blica, toda vez que son ellos los encargados de canalizar los recursos. Estamos expectantes a que se concretice el inter√©s de varios‚Äù, explic√≥.
Tambi√©n inform√≥ que se concluy√≥ el informe t√©cnico de condiciones previas y el informe de justificaci√≥n de conveniencia t√©cnica para una posible adjudicaci√≥n ‚Äúllave en mano‚Äù. En este sentido, el pasado lunes, el gobernador Humberto S√°nchez emiti√≥ la Resoluci√≥n Departamental 076/2024, que viabiliza y posiciona el proyecto en el Sistema Nacional de Inversi√≥n P√∫blica, mencion√≥.
La obra requiere de una inversi√≥n de 600 millones de d√≥lares para la infraestructura y equipamiento, y aproximadamente seis a√±os para su ejecuci√≥n. Se construir√° en el Distrito 3 de Cercado, en una superficie de 185.805,30 metros cuadrados, en el exhip√≥dromo.
Bazoberry indic√≥ que cuenta con el apoyo de la Organizaci√≥n Panamericana de la Salud (OPS). Durante las √∫ltimas semanas, la Gobernaci√≥n socializ√≥ el proyecto con diferentes sectores e instituciones, entre ellas, la Brigada Parlamentaria, Trabajadores de la Salud P√∫blica, la Central Obrera (COD) y el Comit√© C√≠vico.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Attorney claims graphic ‚Äòevidence‚Äô suggests accused Gilgo Beach serial killer did not live ‚Äòdouble life‚Äô
text:
By Andrea Cavallier ,
57 minutes ago
A New York attorney claimed to have new ‚Äúcircumstantial evidence‚Äù in the Gilgo Beach murder case that he believes could prove accused serial killer Rex Heuermann was not living a double life.
John Ray, who represents the family of Shannan Gilbert, whose disappearance led to the discovery of the ‚ÄòGilgo Four‚Äô remains, said at a press conference on Thursday that Heuermann‚Äôs daughter Victoria , 27, had previously posted to social media disturbing images.
‚ÄúThis appears to be the remains of a human being that looks half-eaten,‚Äù Ray told reporters outside his Long Island office, as he presented images he said were found on her Tumblr blog.
Ray presented his ‚Äúevidence‚Äù exactly a week after Heuermann, 60, was arraigned on murder charges in the 2003 dismemberment death of Jessica Taylor, 20, and the 1993 death of Sandra Costilla, 28. No members of his family have been charged with crimes in relation to the case.
Heuermann‚Äôs estranged wife Asa Ellerup and the couple‚Äôs two children were out of state at the time of the hearing, according to their attorney, Robert Macedonio. They still live in the Massapequa Park home, which has been searched twice.
Ellerup has previously claimed to know nothing about the suspected serial killer‚Äôs ‚Äúdouble life.‚Äù
Heuermann‚Äôs adult children, Victoria Heuermann and Christopher Sheridan, have been ‚Äúcaught in the cross hairs of this deeply unfortunate case that they have nothing to do with other than they are related to Mr. Heuermann,‚Äù their attorney Vess Mitev has previously said.
The Manhattan architect has already been charged with the 2009 and 2010 murders of Megan Waterman, Melissa Barthelemy, Amber Lynn Costello and Maureen Brainard-Barnes ‚Äî known as the ‚ÄúGilgo Four.‚Äù He pleaded not guilty in all five murders.
Ray claimed the photos they allegedly found on Heuermann‚Äôs daughter‚Äôs social media accounts show that Victoria was ‚Äúbrought up in this sickness.‚Äù
‚ÄùThe evidence that we have suggests that we have been sold a story by the Heuermann family,‚Äù he said, without offering anything to back up his wild assertions beyond photos.
Ray showed several gruesome images to the press on Thursday from Victoria‚Äôs alleged account that he says show a ‚Äústrange familiarity‚Äù to Heuermann‚Äôs alleged victims, including Jessica Taylor, whose torso was found in a wooded area of manorville in July 2003. Her skull, hands and forearm, were found on Gilgo Beach in 2011. Another image appears to show remains that are ‚Äúhalf eaten,‚Äù Ray claimed.
Lawyer Misty Marris told ‚ÄúNewsNation Now‚Äù the ‚Äúcircumstantial evidence‚Äù proves nothing.
‚ÄúTo implicate the family at this point, without evidence, without the task force or prosecutors making that link, it just seems incredibly premature,‚Äù Marris said.
Last month, Gilgo Beach Task Force investigators completed a second search of Heuermann‚Äôs home in Massapequa Park and a search of an area of Manorville.
Suffolk County District Attorney Ray Tierney revealed that Heuermann kept a ‚Äúblueprint‚Äù of his crimes on a hard drive in his basement of his Massapequa Park home which was recently searched for a second time.
Tierney said Gilgo Beach Task Force believes ‚Äúthis planning document that was used by Heuermann to plot out his kills with excruciating detail.‚Äù
‚ÄúHis motivations, meticulous planning, and clear intent were obvious,‚Äù Tierney told reporters following the arraignment. ‚ÄúHis intent was nothing short but to murder these victims.‚Äù
Expand All Read in NewsBreak
